SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 12th JUNE, 1918.
1. During their counter-attack yesterday afternoon the French inflicted very heavy losses on the enemy. So far, about 1000 prisoners have been captured and 3 guns.
The enemy continues to exert pressure on the western bank of the 0ISE, and has captured the villages of MaCHEMONT and MELICOCQ.
Our line now runs approximately as follows :- east of the OISE as described in last night's Battle Situation, west of the OISE, BETHANCOURT (French) MACKEMONT (German) MELICOCQ (German), thence along the southern bank of the RIVER KATZ to MAREST-SUR-MATZ, LE ZOET, ANTHEUIL (French) GARENNE FARM, BELLOY (French), MERY (French) 500 yards east of COURCELLES, HILL 98 (east of LE PLOYRON), LE TRONQUOY (German) LE FRETOY (French), thence to original front line about LE MANCHEL.
2. On the British front the situation remains unchanged.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
12th June, 1918.
Issued at 12.40 p.m.
For the personal information of the Minister only.
